thread.title: Do's top 10 list: Festivals in Savannah celebrate pirates, Latin culture and more
thread.title_full: Do's top 10 list: Festivals in Savannah celebrate pirates, Latin culture and more

author: Heather Henley
title: Do's top 10 list: Festivals in Savannah celebrate pirates, Latin culture and more
text:
There are plenty of festivals to fill your fall in Savannah and Tybee! Read on for more about Fiesta Latina, the Savannah Greek Festival, Tybee Island Pirate Fest and more: 

Tybee Island Pirate Fest: Oct. 8-11; v arious locations on Tybee Island; $50 for Buccaneer Ball; $12 on Oct. 9; $15 on Oct. 10; free on Oct. 11 and all weekend for children 12 and younger; $25 for a weekend pass 

Savannah Greek Festival: 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 8-10; Hellenic Community Center, 14 W. Anderson St.; f ree until 4 p.m. Oct. 8-9; $2 donation after 4 p.m. Oct. 8-9 and all day Oct. 10 

Fiesta Latina: N oon-7 p.m. Oct. 10; River Street, Rousakis Plaza; f ree 

Beijing Opera: Amazing China: 7 p.m. Oct. 10; Lucas Theatre, 32 Abercorn St.; f ree 

Savannah Folk Music Festival: Oct. 9, 10 and 11; Ellis Square, First Presbyterian Church and Grayson Stadium; free 

Making Strides Against Breast Cancer: Oct. 10; registration at 8:30 a.m. and walk at 10 a.m.; Ellis Square; donations accepted 
Step Out: Walk to Stop Diabetes: Oct. 10; registration at 8 a.m. and walk at 9 a.m.; Forsyth Park; d onations accepted 

Seventh annual Midnight Garden Ride and the Good and Evil Party: 7 p.m. Oct. 10 with costume contest before and party after; Ellis Square; $20 for Savannah Bicycle Campaign members and $30 for non-members in advance; $35 on Oct. 10 

Savannah Stage Company presents “The Legend of Sleepy Hollow”: 8 p.m. Oct. 9, 10, 15, 16, 17, 23, 24, 30, 31; 2 p.m. Oct. 18; Ampersand third floor, 36 Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd.; $15 or pay what you can 

Kylesa with Inter Arma, Indian Handcrafts and Irata: 9 p.m. Oct. 9; The Jinx, 127 W. Congress St.; $15 

View the Do Savannah "Big Calendar" mobile app
